info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 1:58PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern San Miguel and southwestern Montrose Counties through 230 PM MDT... At 158 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Slick Rock, or 28 miles southeast of La Sal, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Pea size hail. Brief, heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern San Miguel and southwestern Montrose Counties, including the following locations... Vancorum. This includes the following highways... Colorado 90 between mile markers 20 and 33. Colorado 141 between mile markers 16 and 43, and between mile markers 63 and 64. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
